anvil.api.Internal

Class Runner

  • java.lang.Object
    • anvil.api.Internal.Runner

  • public class Runner
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the data structure that contains the actual server process itself.

    Runner objects run a separate process to run the server. They also use a separate thread to run the ServerOutputLine interpreter cleanly. Minecraft servers, themselves, tend to use only 1 thread at a time, but can use more occasionally.

    Each Runner object uses the directory of the passed Run file as a working directory. This means that Anvil can be placed anywhere you'd like, and still run each server in a separate directory seamlessly.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Garrett Stonis

    • Constructor Detail

      • Runner

        public Runner(java.lang.String runLocation,
              boolean isJar,
              java.lang.String tag)
        Constructs a Runner instance with the given Run file location.
        Parameters:
        runLocation - String object containing the location of the Run file for the server.
        isJar - Boolean representing whether or not the given Run file is the server.jar file itself. If false, the Run file should contain 1 line with everything needed to start up the server, including all arguments.
        tag - String object containing the tag of the Runner object. This is just an identifier for the Runner. Each one should be unique.

      • Runner

        public Runner(java.io.File runFile,
              boolean isJar,
              java.lang.String tag)
        Constructs a Runner instance with the given Run file location.
        Parameters:
        runFile - File object containing the Run file for the server.
        isJar - Boolean representing whether or not the given Run file is the server.jar file itself. If false, the Run file should contain 1 line with everything needed to start up the server, including all arguments.
        tag - String object containing the tag of the Runner object. This is just an identifier for the Runner. Each one should be unique.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public boolean start()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Starts this Runner object.

        This Runner's input and output are now active and can be used fully.

        Most server.jar files take up to 30 seconds to start up, sometimes longer when using a lot of mods. This needs to be taken into account when using custom Runners. As for all recognized Runners (Runners in the RunnerManager), the PlugIn.onServerStart(String) is run after any given Runner is done starting.

        Starts the ServerOutputLine interpreter for this Runner.

        Returns:
        Whether or not this Runner was successfully started.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When process creation fails.

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Stops this Runner object gracefully (allows the server thread to end itself).

        Is the same as stop(boolean), just passes true for wait and catches any possible InterruptedExceptions.

        Returns:
        Whether or not this Runner was successfully stopped.
        See Also:
        stop(boolean)

      • stop

        public boolean stop(boolean wait)
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Stops this Runner object gracefully (allows the server thread to end itself).
        Parameters:
        wait - Boolean value representing whether or not this thread should wait for the server thread to die. May cause Anvil to momentarily stop responding if true and the server is taking a while to stop.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this Runner was successfully stopped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - When waiting for the server thread to die is interrupted. Will not be thrown if wait is false.
        See Also:
        stop(), stopForcibly()

      • stopForcibly

        public boolean stopForcibly()
        Forcibly stops this Runner object.

        WARNING! Can cause corruption in the world. Only use when necessary.

        Returns:
        Whether or not this Runner was successfully stopped.
        See Also:
        stop(boolean), stop()

      • checkStatus

        public boolean checkStatus()
        Checks whether or not the server is still started or stopped. This is to stop any discrepancies from the server being shutdown from in-game rather than through the API.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the server is still running. True if running, false otherwise.

      • waitForServer

        public void waitForServer()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Causes the current thread to wait for the server to stop.

        If the server's process dies in any way, this thread will continue.

        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - When waiting for the server thread to die is interrupted.

      • getNextOutputLine

        public ServerOutputLine getNextOutputLine()
        Gets the next output line from the server's queue.

        This method is a blocking method, meaning that if there are no output lines in the queue, this method makes the current thread wait indefinitely until it has a value, which it will return. If the current thread is interrupted, it'll return null.

        Returns:
        ServerOutputLine object containing the next output line in the queue. Null if the current thread is interrupted.
        See Also:
        ServerOutputLine

      • writeToServer

        public boolean writeToServer(java.lang.String message)
        Writes a message to the server. The given String is written as-is to the server.
        Parameters:
        message - String object containing the desired message to send.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the write was successful.

      • getRunFile

        public java.io.File getRunFile()
        Gets the File object this Runner is using to represent the server.jar/Run_script file.
        Returns:
        File object containing this Runner's server.jar/Run_script file.

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Gets the tag as a String object.
        Returns:
        String object containing the tag of the Runner.
